greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Xmult(n,7) or rule150(n,1).
example: Sequence gives binary encodings of polynomials in maximal ideal generated by x^2 + x + 1 in the polynomial ring GF(2)[X]. E.g. 1 * x^2+x+1 = x^2 +x+1 = 111 (binary encoding) = 7 (in decimal) x * x^2+x+1 = x^3+x^2+x = 1110 = 14 x+1 * x^2+x+1 = x^3+1 = 1001 = 9 x^2 * x^2+x+1 = x^4+x^3+x^2 = 11100 = 28 x^2+1 * x^2+x+1 = x^4+x^3+x+1 = 11011 = 27 etc.
results.author: Antti Karttunen, Apr 26 1999
